00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * This file is resposible for including all system dependent
00044  * headers for the cvmx-* files.
00045  *
00046  * <hr>$Revision: 129707 $<hr>
00047 */
00048 
00049 #ifndef __CVMX_PLATFORM_H__
00050 #define __CVMX_PLATFORM_H__
00051 
00052 #include "cvmx-abi.h"
00053 
00054 #ifdef __cplusplus
00055 #define EXTERN_ASM extern "C"
00056 #else
00057 #define EXTERN_ASM extern
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 /* This file defines macros for use in determining the current
00061     building environment. It defines a single CVMX_BUILD_FOR_*
00062     macro representing the target of the build. The current
00063     possibilities are:
00064         CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT
00065         CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00066         CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_USER
00067         CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST
00068         CVMX_BUILD_FOR_VXWORKS
00069         CVMX_BUILD_FOR_STANDALONE */
00070 #if defined(__U_BOOT__)
00071     /* We are being used inside of Uboot */
00072 #define CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT
00073 #elif defined(__linux__)
00074 #if defined(__KERNEL__)
00075     /* We are in the Linux kernel on Octeon */
00076 #define CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00077 #elif !defined(__mips__)
00078     /* We are being used under Linux but not on Octeon. Assume
00079        we are on a Linux host with an Octeon target over PCI/PCIe */
00080 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST
00081 #define CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST
00082 #endif
00083 #else
00084 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST
00085         /* This is a manual special case. The host PCI utilities can
00086            be configured to run on Octeon. In this case it is impossible
00087            to tell the difference between the normal userspace setup
00088            and using cvmx_read/write_csr over the PCI bus. The host
00089            utilites force this define to fix this */
00090 #else
00091         /* We are in the Linux userspace on Octeon */
00092 #define CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_USER
00093 #endif
00094 #endif
00095 #elif defined(_WRS_KERNEL) || defined(VXWORKS_USER_MAPPINGS)
00096     /* We are in VxWorks on Octeon */
00097 #define CVMX_BUILD_FOR_VXWORKS
00098 #elif defined(_OCTEON_TOOLCHAIN_RUNTIME)
00099     /* To build the simple exec toolchain runtime (newlib) library. We
00100        should only use features available on all Octeon models.  */
00101 #define CVMX_BUILD_FOR_TOOLCHAIN
00102 #else
00103     /* We are building a simple exec standalone image for Octeon */
00104 #define CVMX_BUILD_FOR_STANDALONE
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 /* To have a global variable be shared among all cores,
00108  * declare with the CVMX_SHARED attribute.  Ex:
00109  * CVMX_SHARED int myglobal;
00110  * This will cause the variable to be placed in a special
00111  * section that the loader will map as shared for all cores
00112  * This is for data structures use by software ONLY,
00113  * as it is not 1-1 VA-PA mapped.
00114  */
00115 #if !defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST) && !defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT)
00116 #define CVMX_SHARED __attribute__ ((cvmx_shared))
00117 #else
00118 #define CVMX_SHARED
00119 #endif
00120 
00121 /* Thread local storage , to have a global variable be per core
00122  * in case of thread or process */
00123 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_USER
00124 #define CVMX_TLS __thread
00125 #else
00126 #define CVMX_TLS
00127 #endif
00128 
00129 
00130 
00131 #if defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT)
00132 
00133 #include <common.h>
00134 #include <stdbool.h>
00135 #include "cvmx-sysinfo.h"
00136 
00137 #elif defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL)
00138 
00139 #include <linux/kernel.h>
00140 #include <linux/string.h>
00141 #include <linux/types.h>
00142 #include <stdarg.h>
00143 
00144 #elif defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_USER)
00145 
00146 #include <stddef.h>
00147 #include <stdint.h>
00148 #include <stdbool.h>
00149 #include <stdio.h>
00150 #include <stdlib.h>
00151 #include <stdarg.h>
00152 #include <string.h>
00153 #include <assert.h>
00154 #include <fcntl.h>
00155 #include <sys/mman.h>
00156 #include <unistd.h>
00157 #include <errno.h>
00158 #include <sys/sysmips.h>
00159 #define MIPS_CAVIUM_XKPHYS_READ    2010 /* XKPHYS */
00160 #define MIPS_CAVIUM_XKPHYS_WRITE       2011 /* XKPHYS */
00161 
00162 /* Enable access to XKPHYS segments. Warning message is printed in case of
00163    error. If warn_count is set, the warning message is not displayed. */
00164 static inline void cvmx_linux_enable_xkphys_access(int32_t warn_count)
00165 {
00166     int ret;
00167     ret = sysmips(MIPS_CAVIUM_XKPHYS_WRITE, getpid(), 3, 0);
00168     if (ret != 0 && !warn_count) {
00169         switch (errno) {
00170         case EINVAL:
00171             perror("sysmips(MIPS_CAVIUM_XKPHYS_WRITE) failed.\n"
00172                    "  Did you configure your kernel with both:\n"
00173                    "     CONFIG_CAVIUM_OCTEON_USER_MEM_PER_PROCESS *and*\n" "     CONFIG_CAVIUM_OCTEON_USER_IO_PER_PROCESS?");
00174             break;
00175         case EPERM:
00176             perror("sysmips(MIPS_CAVIUM_XKPHYS_WRITE) failed.\n" "  Are you running as root?");
00177             break;
00178         default:
00179             perror("sysmips(MIPS_CAVIUM_XKPHYS_WRITE) failed");
00180             break;
00181         }
00182     }
00183 }
00184 
00185 #elif defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST)
00186 
00187 #include <stddef.h>
00188 #include <stdint.h>
00189 #include <stdbool.h>
00190 #include <stdio.h>
00191 #include <stdlib.h>
00192 #include <stdarg.h>
00193 #include <string.h>
00194 #include <assert.h>
00195 #include <fcntl.h>
00196 #include <sys/mman.h>
00197 #include <unistd.h>
00198 
00199 #elif defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_VXWORKS)
00200 
00201 #include <stdint.h>
00202 #include <stdbool.h>
00203 #include <stdio.h>
00204 #include <stdlib.h>
00205 #include <stdarg.h>
00206 #include <string.h>
00207 #include <assert.h>
00208 
00209 #elif defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_STANDALONE)
00210 
00211 #include <stddef.h>
00212 #include <stdbool.h>
00213 #include <stdint.h>
00214 #include <stdio.h>
00215 #include <stdlib.h>
00216 #include <stdarg.h>
00217 #include <string.h>
00218 #include <assert.h>
00219 
00220 #elif defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_TOOLCHAIN)
00221 
00222 #ifndef __ASSEMBLY__
00223 #include <stddef.h>
00224 #include <stdint.h>
00225 #include <stdbool.h>
00226 #include <stdio.h>
00227 #include <stdlib.h>
00228 #include <stdarg.h>
00229 #include <string.h>
00230 #include <assert.h>
00231 #endif
00232 #include "rename-cvmx.h"
00233 
00234 #else
00235 
00236 #error Unexpected CVMX_BUILD_FOR_* macro
00237 
00238 #endif
00239 
00240 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00241 #define EXPORT_SYMBOL(X)
00242 #endif
00243 
00244 #endif /* __CVMX_PLATFORM_H__ */
